If it's just a list, here's the one in Yamanaka's index:

Honjo Masamune
Kuniyuki
Masatsune
Phoenix Tachi
Phoenix Tachi
Rai Kunimitsu
Kunihiro (?) a Kamakura Jyunin  [Yamanaka's "(?)," not mine]
Bishu Osafune Iesuke
Nagamitsu
Botan Zukuri Tanto
Archaic Tachi
Norishige Katana
Soshu ju Akihiro
Shumen o Suke Ichinohira Yasuyo

There are no doubt far better qualified people than me to comment on this list.  

Jim



  No idea. I don't think she has much of an idea either. She just read
  something with her son (elementary school student) and threw out a bunch of
  random questions. As I didn't have a list, I thought most anything would do.
  I will check Jim's site, thanks.



  Gordon

  Gordon,
  Assuming that you're just talking about swords, Albert Yamanaka published a
  list with descriptions in his newsletters, although I have no idea if it is
  complete or correct.  He has 14 Kokuho and 25 Juyo Bijutsuhin described.
  This was a particular area of interest of the late Jim Kurrasch and he
  published something on his web site at
  http://members.cox.net/jkk/misimpor.htm  Not all of the items that Yamanaka
  mentioned are on Jim's site.

  What exactly is she looking for?

  Jim
